==Events==
* [[838]] &ndash; [[Battle of Anzen]]: the Byzantine emperor [[Theophilos (emperor)|Theophilos]] suffers a heavy defeat by the [[Abbasids]].
*[[1099]] &ndash; [[First Crusade]]: [[Godfrey of Bouillon]] is elected the first Defender of the [[Holy Sepulchre]] of The [[Kingdom of Jerusalem]].
*[[1209]] &ndash; [[Massacre at Béziers]]: the first major military action of the [[Albigensian Crusade]].
*[[1298]] &ndash; [[Wars of Scottish Independence]]: [[Battle of Falkirk (1298)|Battle of Falkirk]] &ndash; King [[Edward I of England]] and his [[longbowmen]] defeat [[William Wallace]] and his Scottish [[Sheltron|schiltrons]] outside the town of [[Falkirk]].
*[[1456]] &ndash; [[Ottoman Wars in Europe]]: [[Siege of Belgrade (1456)|Siege of Belgrade]] &ndash; [[John Hunyadi]], Regent of the [[Kingdom of Hungary]], defeats [[Mehmet II]] of the [[Ottoman Empire]]
*[[1484]] &ndash; [[Battle of Lochmaben Fair]] &ndash; A 500-man raiding party led by [[Alexander Stewart, Duke of Albany]] and [[James Douglas, 9th Earl of Douglas]] are defeated by Scots forces loyal to Albany's brother [[James III of Scotland]]; Douglas is captured.
*[[1499]] &ndash; [[Battle of Dornach]] &ndash; The [[Old Swiss Confederacy|Swiss]] decisively defeat the [[Holy Roman Empire|Imperial]] army of [[Emperor Maximilian I]].
*[[1587]] &ndash; [[Colony of Roanoke]]: a second group of English settlers arrives on [[Roanoke Island]] off [[North Carolina]] to re-establish the deserted colony.
*[[1686]] &ndash; [[Albany, New York]] is formally chartered as a municipality by Governor [[Thomas Dongan]].
*[[1706]] &ndash; The [[Acts of Union 1707]] are agreed upon by commissioners from the [[Kingdom of England]] and the [[Kingdom of Scotland]], which, when passed by each countries' Parliaments, lead to the creation of the [[Kingdom of Great Britain]].
*[[1793]] &ndash; [[Alexander Mackenzie (explorer)|Alexander Mackenzie]] reaches the [[Pacific Ocean]] becoming the first recorded human to complete a transcontinental crossing of [[Canada]].
*[[1796]] &ndash; Surveyors of the [[Connecticut Land Company]] name an area in [[Ohio]] "[[Cleveland, Ohio|Cleveland]]" after Gen. [[Moses Cleaveland]], the superintendent of the surveying party.
*[[1797]] &ndash; [[Battle of Santa Cruz de Tenerife (1797)|Battle of Santa Cruz de Tenerife]]: Battle between Spanish and British naval forces during the [[French Revolutionary Wars]]. During the Battle, Rear-Admiral [[Horatio Nelson, 1st Viscount Nelson|Nelson]] is wounded in the arm and the arm had to be partially amputated.
*[[1805]] &ndash; [[Napoleonic Wars]]: [[War of the Third Coalition]] &ndash; [[Battle of Cape Finisterre (1805)|Battle of Cape Finisterre]] &ndash; an inconclusive naval action is fought between a combined French and Spanish fleet under Admiral [[Pierre-Charles Villeneuve]] of Spain and a British fleet under Admiral [[Robert Calder]].
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[Napoleonic Wars]]: [[Peninsular War]] &ndash; [[Battle of Salamanca]] &ndash; [[United Kingdom|British]] forces led by [[Arthur Wellesley, 1st Duke of Wellington|Arthur Wellesley]] (later the Duke of Wellington) defeat [[France|French]] troops near [[Salamanca]], [[Spain]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Atlanta]] &ndash; outside [[Atlanta, Georgia]], [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] General [[John Bell Hood]] leads an unsuccessful attack on [[United States|Union]] troops under General [[William T. Sherman]] on Bald Hill.
*[[1894]] &ndash; The [[Paris–Rouen (motor race)|first ever motor race]] is held in [[France]] between the cities of [[Paris]] and [[Rouen]]. The fastest finisher was the Comte [[Jules-Albert de Dion]], but The 'official' victory was awarded to [[Albert Lemaître]] driving his 3&nbsp;hp petrol engined [[Peugeot]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; In [[San Francisco, California]], a bomb explodes on [[Market Street (San Francisco)|Market Street]] during a [[Preparedness Day]] parade killing 10 and injuring 40.
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Wiley Post]] becomes the first person to fly solo around the world traveling {{convert|15596|mi}} in 7 days, 18 hours and 45 minutes.
*[[1934]] &ndash; Outside [[Chicago]]'s [[Biograph Theater]], "Public Enemy No. 1" [[John Dillinger]] is mortally wounded by [[FBI]] agents.
*[[1937]] &ndash; [[New Deal]]: the [[United States Senate]] votes down President [[Franklin Delano Roosevelt|Franklin D. Roosevelt]]'s proposal to [[Judiciary Reorganization Bill of 1937|add more justices]] to the [[Supreme Court of the United States]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; The [[United States government]] begins compulsory civilian [[gasoline]] [[rationing]] due to the wartime demands.
*  1942   &ndash; [[The Holocaust|Holocaust]]: the systematic deportation of [[Jew]]s from the [[Warsaw Ghetto]] begins.
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] forces capture the [[Italy|Italian]] city of [[Palermo]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; The [[Polish Committee of National Liberation]] publishes its [[PKWN Manifesto|manifesto]], starting the period of [[People's Republic of Poland|Communist rule]] in [[Poland]]
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[King David Hotel bombing]]: a Zionist underground organisation, the [[Irgun]], bombs the [[King David Hotel]] in [[Jerusalem]], site of the civil administration and military headquarters for [[British Mandate for Palestine|Mandate Palestine]], resulting in 91 deaths.
*[[1951]] &ndash; Dezik (Дезик) and Tsygan (Цыган, "Gypsy") are the [[Soviet space dogs|first dogs to make a sub-orbital flight]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Mariner program]]: ''[[Mariner 1]]'' spacecraft flies erratically several minutes after launch and has to be destroyed.
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[Crown Colony of Sarawak|Sarawak]] achieve independence.
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Japan]] completes its last reparation to the [[Philippines]] for war crimes committed during the imperial Japan's conquest of the country in the [[Second World War]]
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[China|Chinese]] leader [[Deng Xiaoping]] is restored to power.
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Martial law in Poland]] is officially revoked.
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Jeffrey Dahmer]] is arrested in [[Milwaukee]] after police discover human remains in his apartment.
*[[1992]] &ndash; Near [[Medellín]], [[Colombia]]n [[drug lord]] [[Pablo Escobar]] escapes from his luxury prison fearing extradition to the [[United States]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Great Flood of 1993]]: [[levee]]s near [[Kaskaskia, Illinois]] rupture, forcing the entire town to evacuate by barges operated by the [[United States Army Corps of Engineers|Army Corps of Engineers]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; The second [[Blue Water Bridge]] opens between [[Port Huron, Michigan]] and [[Sarnia, Ontario]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; Members of [[101st Airborne Division|101st Airborne]] of the [[United States]], aided by Special Forces, attack a compound in [[Iraq]], killing [[Saddam Hussein]]'s sons [[Uday Hussein|Uday]] and [[Qusay Hussein|Qusay]], along with [[Mustapha Hussein]], Qusay's 14-year old son, and a bodyguard.
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[Jean Charles de Menezes]] is killed by police as the hunt begins for the London Bombers responsible for the [[7 July 2005 London bombings]] and the [[21 July 2005 London bombings]].
*[[2011]] &ndash; [[Norway]] is the victim of [[2011 Norway attacks|twin terror attacks]], the first being a bomb blast which targeted government buildings in central [[Oslo]], the second being a massacre at a youth camp on the island of [[Utøya]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; A [[2013 Dingxi earthquakes|series of earthquakes]] in [[Dingxi]], [[China]], kills at least 89 people and injures more than 500 others.
